comments.body: You need to always set self.prompt here.  Since the code sets prompt  to None at the top of the file, I think self.prompt = prompt would work.  Otherwise, just an `else: self.prompt = None` would work.

comments.body: A simpler version might be setting the become sudo_pass magic var and letting the lines above (385) deal with it

Lines 380-85 doesn't deal with this because it won't override become_pass.  We need to know that we're dealing with vars that came from the inventory and that they're only overriding vars that came from the command line.
~~you still don't deal with `check_mode: False` and~~ now always_run will override check_mode setting, I would reverse it in view of deprecating always_run

        # check_mode replaces always_run, overwrite always_run if both are given
        if task.check_mode is not None:

comments.body: I would change the message to just: `always_run is deprecated. Use check_mode instead`
In 2.1 one used `always_run: yes` and with the short message one might try `check_mode: yes`, which is the opposite.
